description: The Nikola Tesla Museum is a science museum located in Belgrade, Serbia, dedicated to honoring and displaying the life and work of Nikola Tesla as well as serving as the final resting place for Tesla. The museum is housed in a residential villa built in 1927 according to the designs of Dragiša Brašovan, a distinguished Serbian architect.

collection.unesco_recognition: The Nikola Tesla Archive was inscribed on UNESCO's Memory of the World Programme Register in 2003 due to its critical role regarding history of electrification of the world and future technological advancements

inventions: Induction engine, which made using alternating current practical
personal_items: Tesla's ashes in a golden orb

tour_experience.introduction: Short film of Tesla's life including birth, studies, and achievements
tour_experience.demonstrations: Docent conducts various presentations throughout the tour
tour_experience.highlight: Transmission of electrical energy without wires - visitors are given fluorescent tubes while the Tesla coil generates actual lightning, and the free energy produced illuminates the tube in their hands

tickets.group_discount: 300 RSD for groups of ten or more (must be booked in advance)
tickets.children: Free for children under 7 years of age

visiting_information.photography: Allowed in most places and during the guided tour

visitor_tips.duration: Allow about one hour for the full experience
visitor_tips.highlights: Don't miss the Tesla Coil demonstration and the wireless energy transmission

interesting_facts: Final resting place of Nikola Tesla - his ashes are kept in a golden orb
UNESCO Memory of the World recognition for the Tesla Archive (2003)
Over 160,000 original documents in the collection
Interactive demonstrations allow visitors to experience Tesla's inventions firsthand
Visitors can illuminate fluorescent tubes using wireless energy transmission
Tesla Coil generates actual lightning during demonstrations
